Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.api.index

Class MultipleIndexPopulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.api.index.MultipleIndexPopulator
  • public class MultipleIndexPopulator
extends Object
    There are two ways data is fed to this multi-populator:
    • A StoreScan is created through createStoreScan(PageCursorTracer). The store scan is started by StoreScan.run(), which is a blocking call and will scan the entire store and generate updates that are fed into the populators. Only a single call to this method should be made during the life time of a MultipleIndexPopulator and should be called by the same thread instantiating this instance.
    • queueConcurrentUpdate(IndexEntryUpdate) which queues updates which will be read by the thread currently executing the store scan and incorporated into that data stream. Calls to this method may come from any number of concurrent threads.

    Usage of this class should be something like:

    1. Instantiation.
    2. One or more calls to addPopulator(IndexPopulator, IndexDescriptor, FlippableIndexProxy, FailedIndexProxyFactory, String).
    3. Call to create(PageCursorTracer) to create data structures and files to start accepting updates.
    4. Call to createStoreScan(PageCursorTracer) and StoreScan.run()(blocking call).
    5. While all nodes are being indexed, calls to queueConcurrentUpdate(IndexEntryUpdate) are accepted.
    6. Call to flipAfterStoreScan(boolean, PageCursorTracer) after successful population, or cancel(Throwable, PageCursorTracer) if not

    The incoming updates from the StoreScan are batched in sizes of BATCH_SIZE_SCAN and then flushed separately by different threads using JobScheduler.

    It is possible for concurrent updates from transactions to arrive while index population is in progress. Such updates are inserted in the queue. When store scan notices that queue size has reached QUEUE_THRESHOLD then it drains all batched updates and waits for all job scheduler tasks to complete and flushes updates from the queue using MultipleIndexPopulator.MultipleIndexUpdater. If queue size never reaches QUEUE_THRESHOLD than all queued concurrent updates are flushed after the store scan in flipAfterStoreScan(boolean, PageCursorTracer).

      • queueConcurrentUpdate

        void queueConcurrentUpdate​(IndexEntryUpdate<?> update)
        Queues an update to be fed into the index populators. These updates come from changes being made to storage while a concurrent scan is happening to keep populators up to date with all latest changes.
        Parameters:
        update - IndexEntryUpdate to queue.

      • cancel

        public void cancel​(Throwable failure,
                   PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Cancel all index populations, putting the indexes in failed state. To repopulate them they will need to be dropped and recreated.
        Parameters:
        failure - the cause.

      • cancel

        protected void cancel​(MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation population,
                      Throwable failure,
                      PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Cancel a single index population, putting the index in failed state. To repopulate the index it needs to be dropped and recreated.
        Parameters:
        population - Index population to cancel.
        failure - the cause.

      • newPopulatingUpdater

        MultipleIndexPopulator.MultipleIndexUpdater newPopulatingUpdater​(NodePropertyAccessor accessor,
                                                                 PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)

      • close

        public void close()
        Close this multiple index populator. This means population job has finished, successfully or unsuccessfully and resources can be released. Note that index populations cannot be closed. Instead, the underlying index populator is closed by flipAfterStoreScan(boolean, PageCursorTracer), cancel(IndexPopulation, Throwable, PageCursorTracer) or stop(IndexPopulation, PageCursorTracer).

      • resetIndexCounts

        void resetIndexCounts​(PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)

      • resetIndexCountsForPopulation

        private void resetIndexCountsForPopulation​(MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation indexPopulation)

      • flipAfterStoreScan

        void flipAfterStoreScan​(boolean verifyBeforeFlipping,
                        PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        This concludes a successful index population. The last updates will be applied to every index, tell index populators that scan has been completed, index statistics store will be updated with index samples, schema cache will be cleared, index populators will be closed and index proxy will be flipped to online, given that nothing goes wrong.
        Parameters:
        verifyBeforeFlipping - Whether to verify deferred constraints before flipping index proxy. This is used by batch inserter.

      • awaitCompletion

        private void awaitCompletion()
        Awaits AWAIT_TIMEOUT_MINUTES minutes for all previously submitted batch-flush tasks to complete. Restores the interrupted status and exits normally when interrupted during waiting.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if tasks did not complete in AWAIT_TIMEOUT_MINUTES minutes.

      • handleTimeout

        private void handleTimeout()

      • allStackTraces

        private static String allStackTraces()
        Finds all threads and corresponding stack traces which can potentially cause the executor to not terminate in AWAIT_TIMEOUT_MINUTES minutes.
        Returns:
        thread dump as string.
